intro: Relhania biennis, commonly known as the African starling tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, red berries that are edible for some animals. Relhania biennis is typically found in open woodlands and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. Its ecological role includes providing food for birds and insects, contributing to local biodiversity.
